resources.string: Allows the mobile app to use coarse location in order to check-in to places
Any links being opened from the mobile app will open from within the app instead of the browser
Force the use of the mobile or desktop site
EXPERIMENTAL: Automatically hide the ActionBar when not being used. Fling down to make it appear again.
Enable system logging. Useful when helping developer debug problems with the app
Written by Daniel Velazco. Click here for more information.

Facebook is trying to access your location.
 
Most likely you are trying to "Check-in" to a specific place. While Tinfoil has optional permissions used for this, it is disabled by default.
 
You can enable this feature by going to the Preferences and checking the option that says "Allow Check-ins."
 
Tinfoil only shares "Coarse location", this doesn't use the GPS, only Network and Wi-fi location in order to save battery. However, Coarse Location is not as accurate as Fine Location.

Developed by Daniel Velazco. 
velazcod@gmail.com 
http://www.danvelazco.com
 
 
Source code: 
https://github.com/velazcod/Tinfoil-Facebook
 
 
This app is for those users that require a Tinfoil Hat when logging in to Facebook. It creates a sandbox for facebook's mobile site. Requires INTERNET permissions, and if you are skeptic about it, feel free to check the source code listed above. Coarse location permissions are required but location is not used unless you turn "Allow Check-ins" in the preferences.
